text: and the frutes yere saul socht eftir hae depairtit frae ye and a the dainty and delicate things hae perisht frae ye and in naegate sal they be fun
second: praise be to god for his unmeasurable bounty

text: the trokers i thae things they wha becam rich frae her wull staun farawa for the fear o her torment greetin and makin maen sayin wae wae the michty citie that had buskit hersel wi fine linen and purple and scarlet and had dinkt hersel oot wi gowd and jewel and pearl in ae oor has been laid waste sic walth as this and ilka captain and ilka ane gaun to sea stude farawa and cryt oot behauldin the reek o her burnin sayin whatna citie like to this great citie and they cuist stoor on their heids and cryt alood greetin and makin maen sayin wae wae the michty citie in whilk waxt rich a thae haein ships on the sea oot o her luxuries
second: and whatna faither is amang ye wham his son sal ask for a bannock that wad gie him a stane

text: in ae oor is she laid waste be blythe ower her o heeven and a ye saunts and apostles and prophets for god has judged her for yere sakes
second: for gin i be sindry frae ye i the flesh yet am i ane wye i the spirit rejoicin and seein yere orderliness and the steive biggin o yere faith anent christ in sic way as ye received christ jesus the lord in him be walkin bein firmrutit and upbiggit in him and bein made siccar i the faith conform till yere teachin aboundin in thanksgivin

text: and an angel a michty ane liftit up a stane like a great millstane and cuist it into the sea sayin sae wi unco micht sal be hurled doon the great citie babylon and in naegate ony mair be fun
second: and he speirt at them hoo mony bannocks hae ye

text: and voice o harpers and minstrels and pipers and buglers sal be heard in ye nae mair and ony craftsman o ony craft sal be fun in ye nae mair and the soond o a milstane sal be heard in ye nae mair and the licht o a crusie sal nae mair shine in ye
second: the lassies no deid but sleepin

text: and the voice o bridegroom and o bride sal be nae mair heard in ye for thy mairchants war nobles on the yirth for that a the nations war beguiled by her sorceries
second: but as paul appeald to the hearin o the emperor i commandit him to be keepit till sic time as i micht send him up to cesar

text: and the blude o prophets and saunts was fun in her and o a thae that had been slain upon the yirth
second: whaur their worms deesna and their lowe isna quenched and gin yere ee ensnare ye pyke it oot it is bonnier for ye enterin intil life aeeed than wi twa een to be cuisten intil hell whaur their worm deesna and their lowe isna quenched for ilka ane sal be sautit wi fire and ilka offeran sal be sautit wi saut

text: and i saw an angel comin doon frae heeven haein the key o the abyss and a muckle chain in his haun
second: gin aiblins he has eneuch to finish it

text: and he laid haud o the dragon the auld serpent wha is deevil and sautan and chained him for a thoosand year and harled him intil the abyss and steekit it and sealt it aboon him that he soud nae mair beguile the nations to the end o the thoosandyear and eftir that he bude be lowsed a wee while
second: and hoo sal they publish gin they warna sent oot

text: and i saw throns and they sat on them and judgmentpooer was gien to them and i saw the sauls o them that war beheidit for the testimonie o jesus and for the word o god and sae mony as worshippedna the beast nor his image and tookna the brand on the broo nor on the haun and they leeved wi christ and reigned wi him a thoosand year
second: paul an apostle o jesus christ by gods wull and timothy oor brither to the kirk o god whilk is in corinth wi a the saunts i the hail o greece lovinfavor to ye and quateness frae god oor faither and the lord jesus christ

text: and the lave o the deid leevedna till soud be endit the thoosand year
second: and they keepit it to their sels and tellt nae man i thae days whatna things they had seen

text: happy and holie he wha has pairt in the first risinagain ower siclike the second death has nae pooer but they sal be the priests o god and o christ and sal reign wi him for the thoosand year and whaneer the thoosand year is endit sautan wull be lowsed oot o his thrall and wull gang oot to beguile the nations that are i the fowr corners o the yirth gog and magog to gaither them thegither for the war o wham the number is as the sand o the sea
second: and jesus gaed oot frae the temple and was gangin his ways and his disciples cam to airt him to look at the biggins o the temple

text: and they cam up spreadoot ower the breidth o the yirth and rinkitroond the camp o the saunts and the weelloed citie and fire cam doon frae god oot o heeven and devoort them
second: and a the folk answert him we hae heard oot o the law that the anointit ane bides for aye and hoo say ye the son o mans to be upliftit

text: and the fae he that was beguilin them was cuisten intil the loch o fire and brunstane whaur eke war cuisten the beast and the fauseprophet and they sal be tormentit day and nicht for evir and evir
second: and for this too we are aye giean thanks to god that whan ye had frae us the word o the message een gods message ye took it to ye no as mans word but een as it is truly gods word whilk is een workin inwardly in you wha believe

text: and i saw a great white thron and him that sat on it frae whase face the heeven and yirth fled awa and place wasna fund for them
second: ye spawn o vipers hoo are ye bein ill to speak gude things

text: and i saw the deid the great and the sma staun afore the thron and buiks war unsealt and anither buik was unsealt whilk is the buikolife and the deid war judged oot o the things that war puttendoon i the buiks conform to their warks
second: and he had in his haun a wee bookie open and he set his richt fit on the sea and his left fit on the lan and cryt oot wi a soondin voice as a lion wad roar

text: and the sea gied up the deid that war int and death and the grave gied up the deid that war in them and they war judged ilka ane conform to their warks
second: wha is a leear gin it bena he that denies that jesus is the anointit

text: and death and the grave war cuisten intil the loch o fire this is the second death the lowin loch
second: the man no mairryt is tentie aboot the lords things hoo he may pleasur the lord whauras the man mairryt is tentie aboot his wifes maitters hoo he may pleasur his wife and sae is dividit

text: and gin ony ane wasna fund puttendoon i the buikolife he was cuisten intil the lowin loch
second: and she had a sister cad mary wha was aye sittin narby the feet o jesus hearin his words
